statement.tex: \\ \text{What are the conditions for a function}\\ \text{to be strictly increasing or decreasing?}

reason.tex: \text{A strictly increasing/decreasing function cannot}\\ \text{be flat }-f'(x)=0 - \text{anywhere in the interval.}\\ \text{Hence, }f'(x)\gt 0\text{ or }f'(x)\lt 0.
\text{Apply chain rule }-\dfrac{d}{dx}f\cdot g = f'g + g'f - \text{and simplify.}

options.tex: \begin{tabular}{ccccc} \text{If...}& (x+1)^2& (x-3)^2& (x-1)& f'(x)\\ x\lt -1& + & + & - & - \\ x=-1&0&+&-&0\\ -1\lt x\lt 1& + & + & - & -\\ 1\lt x\lt 3& + & + & + & + \\ x=3& + & 0 & + & 0 \\ x\gt 3& + & + & + & + \end{tabular} \\ \text{In conclusion} \\ \begin{tabular}{cc} \text{strictly decreasing}& x\in \left(-\infty,-1\right)\cup\left(-1,1\right)\\ \text{strictly increasing}& x\in \left(1,3\right)\cup\left(3,\infty\right) \end{tabular}
